Summary Note:
Jenna Kaisa Turunen and the RM are cousins, having grown up together in Helsinki. Their familial bond has naturally extended into a professional partnership built on mutual respect and shared values.
With a career spanning nearly 26 years, Jenna Kaisa Turunen has established herself as a key player in the industry.
She was drawn to Julius Baer's holistic financial planning and investment strategies, prompting the decision to join.
Family Background: Jenna Kaisa Turunen is currently divorced. Her children are named Turunen, Salminen and Voutilainen.
Education Background:
Jenna received her secondary school diploma from Heinolan lukio in 1994.
After that, she went on to study at University of Lapland Faculty of Art and Design until 1998.
Occupation History:
Jenna Kaisa Turunen is a 50 year old Media Conglomerate Owner from Finland.
In 1999, Jenna Kaisa Turunen started working as a Journalist at Sanoma Media Finland Oy, marking the beginning of her successful career.
She then transitioned to Sanoma Media Finland Oy as a Editor, leveraging her expertise to drive results from 2005 to 2006.
In 2008, she joined Yleisradio Oy as a Publisher, taking on new challenges and responsibilities that helped her grow both personally and professionally.
After 13 years of dedication, she assumed the role of TV/Radio Host at Alma Media Corporation in 2014, spearheading high-profile projects and mentoring junior colleagues.
She has been a Media Conglomerate Owner at Yleisradio Oy since 2018, consistently demonstrating her ability to adapt, innovate, and thrive in an ever-changing environment.
Wealth Summary:
She managed to save approximately 480000 EUR from her earnings at all companies.
She has townhouse located in Kuopio, worth 760000 EUR.


Following the passing of her grandfather, a successful Neurosurgeon, she received an inheritance of 1060000 EUR in 2015, which she has used to secure her financial future.
Client Summary: In summary, Jenna has demonstrated a strong work ethic and financial acumen, positioning them well for the future.
